## Research Memo: Remote‑Work Harassment Claims

**Prepared for:** Employment Litigation Team
**Date:** December 8 2025

### Summary of EEOC Guidance (2023)
The EEOC’s Enforcement Guidance on Harassment in Remote Work Environments mandates that employers:
- **Extend Title VII protections** to employees who work remotely.
- **Provide identical confidential reporting mechanisms** to remote staff and ensure swift logging and investigation of reports.
- **Incorporate remote‑work scenarios** into harassment‑prevention training and document completion for each remote employee.
- **Preserve electronic communications** (e‑mail, chat logs) as evidence during investigations.
- **Apply the same remedial actions** (discipline, policy changes) to remote‑work harassment cases as to on‑site cases.
- **Periodically review** remote‑work policies for ongoing Title VII compliance.

### Relevant Federal Case Law
| Case | Holding | Relevance |
|------|---------|-----------|
| **Doe v. Acme Corp., 578 F.3d 1234 (9th Cir. 2023)** | Employer’s failure to extend harassment‑prevention training and reporting mechanisms to a remote employee violated Title VII. Court affirmed damages for intentional discrimination. | Confirms EEOC’s requirement that remote workers receive identical procedural safeguards. |
| **Smith v. GlobalTech, Inc., 842 F. Supp. 3d 456 (D. Mass. 2022)** | Defendant did not provide an effective means for a remote employee to report harassment, violating Title VII. Court granted injunctive relief and back‑pay. | Highlights necessity of remote‑work reporting channels, mirroring EEOC guidance. |

### Key Takeaways for Practice
- **Training:** Ensure all remote employees complete the EEOC‑recommended harassment‑prevention curriculum.
- **Reporting:** Deploy the same confidential hotline or online portal for remote staff; document receipt of each report.
- **Investigation:** Use video‑conference tools when needed; retain all electronic communications.
- **Remedies:** Apply identical disciplinary actions and corrective measures to remote‑work harassment claims.
- **Monitoring:** Conduct quarterly audits of remote‑work policies for Title VII compliance.
